name: Valeron Outlander
text: Protection from black

editions.flavor: After years of honing her philosophy in debate with stubborn rhoxes, Niella was ready to convert any heathen.

Renown 2 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)
Whenever a creature you control becomes renowned, draw a card.

editions.flavor: As the outsiders invaded Bant, soldiers who once saw sigils as the highest marks of glory began to see the scars of battle as tokens of equal worth.

name: Valley Dasher
text:
Haste
Valley Dasher attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Mardu riders' greatest fear is that a battle might end before their weapons draw blood.

name: Valleymaker
text:
{T}, Sacrifice a Mountain: Valleymaker deals 3 damage to target creature.
{T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Choose a player. That player adds {G}{G}{G} to his or her mana pool.

editions.flavor: Their home uprooted by a giant, the gang of boggarts mourned their old stomping ground.

text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

text: Target creature can block any number of creatures this turn.

editions.flavor: He listens to every heartbeat, deciding which one of hundreds he will stop.

Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: Some vampires reject the decadent trappings of their kind. Once they turn feral, no amount of blood will satisfy their hunger.

name: Vampire's Bite
text:
Kicker {2}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B} as you cast this spell.)

name: Vampire Warlord
text: Sacrifice another creature: Regenerate Vampire Warlord. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

editions.flavor: "How can you serve me? By dying."

name: Vampiric Dragon
text:
Flying

text:
Enchant creature

Whenever a creature dealt damage by enchanted creature this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

name: Vampiric Feast
text: Vampiric Feast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and you gain 4 life.

editions.flavor: It's not always gold the thief is after.

name: Vampiric Fury
text: Vampire creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Many peasants secretly admire vampires' glamour and elegance—until they witness a moment of pure bloodlust.

name: Vampiric Link
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: The familiar's fangs deliver the master's bite.

name: Vampiric Rites
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life and draw a card.

editions.flavor: For vampires, blood carries more than life. Memories long eroded from the minds of bloodchiefs can be reclaimed from the veins of their sired kin.

name: Vampiric Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have "Whenever a creature dealt damage by this creature this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."

editions.flavor: They draw upon the strength of their hive and of their victims.

name: Vampiric Spirit
text:
Flying
When Vampiric Spirit enters the battlefield, you lose 4 life.

name: Vampiric Touch
text: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to target opponent and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: A touch, not comforting, but of death.

name: Vampiric Tutor
text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."

text: Flying

name: Vastwood Animist
text: {T}: Target land you control becomes an X/X Elemental creature until end of turn, where X is the number of Allies you control. It's still a land.

editions.flavor: He calls on the forests for counsel and summons the earth to his cause.

"A long and difficult incision revealed that all vital organs are housed in the head, save for a long chain of stomachs, forty in all, leading from its throat to the end of the tail."—Mulak Ffar, Vastwood Biodiversity
The gorger's insect-like eyes pick up the slightest movement in any direction. Its body then whips toward its prey with startling speed, swallowing it in one engulfing gulp.

"A long and difficult incision revealed that all vital organs are housed in the head, save for a long chain of stomachs, forty in all, leading from its throat to the end of the tail."
—Mulak Ffar, Vastwood Biodiversity

—Chadir the Navigator

name: Vedalken Archmage

"The Knowledge Pool knows. Memnarch understands."
—Janus, speaker of the synod

name: Vedalken Blademaster
text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: Vedalken have six thin, agile fingers on each hand, giving them unparalleled dexterity.

name: Vedalken Certarch
text: Metalcraft — {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. Activate this ability only if you control three or more artifacts.

editions.flavor: "An appropriately detailed model is indistinguishable from reality, and much easier to control."

name: Vedalken Dismisser
text: When Vedalken Dismisser enters the battlefield, put target creature on top of its owner's library.

"I crept up on him, quiet as a guttermouse. And then suddenly I found myself facedown in a latrine pit behind Tin Street Market."

name: Vedalken Entrancer
text: {U}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Their denial reaches far into your future.

name: Vedalken Ghoul
text: Whenever Vedalken Ghoul becomes blocked, defending player loses 4 life.

editions.flavor: For four nights following Ennor's death and the reclaiming of his etherium, its recipients were found slain, the etherium ripped from their bodies.

name: Vedalken Heretic
text: Whenever Vedalken Heretic deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Etherium clouded my eyes, clogged my ears, desensitized my skin. Now that I can feel, I can begin to learn."

name: Vedalken Infuser
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target artifact.

editions.flavor: "All plans begin as dreams. I intend to awaken them."

name: Vedalken Mastermind
text: {U}, {T}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The vedalken see other beings from a cold distance, as either experimental subjects or objects of study.
The vedalken see other beings from a cold distance, as either experimental subjects or objects of study.

name: Vedalken Orrery
text: You may cast spells as though they had flash.

editions.flavor: The model incorporated the fifth sun effortlessly, as if it had always known.
The model incorporated the fifth sun effortlessly, as if it had always known.

name: Vedalken Outlander
text: Protection from red

editions.flavor: The Seekers of Carmot searched across the unknown lands for the mystical red stone that could reforge Esper in ethereal perfection.

name: Vedalken Plotter

editions.flavor: Some roads are paved with bad intentions.

text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veil of Birds is an enchantment, Veil of Birds becomes a 1/1 Bird creature with flying.
